snippet: New guidelines explicitly ban the financing of and cooperation with Israeli institutions in territory seized during the 1967 war, reflecting increasing tension between Israel and Europe.
abstract: European Union issues guidelines banning financing of and cooperation with Israeli institutions in territory seized during 1967 war, move that Israeli leaders quickly denounce as undermining Secretary of State John Kerry's push to revive peace talks with Palestinians.

byline.contributor: Andrew Higgins contributed reporting from Brussels, and Michael R. Gordon from Amman, Jordan.

lead_paragraph: New guidelines explicitly ban the financing of and cooperation with Israeli institutions in territory seized during the 1967 war, reflecting increasing tension between Israel and Europe.

headline.main: Israel Condemns New European Union Rules on Territory Seized in 1967 War
headline.print_headline: Israel Condemns New European Union Rules on Territory Seized in 1967 War
